提交信息: Reset view->parent both when switching and closing view  Fix regression from 5b15c59f32b40abe1a8aa1db90e485c9a8861465 and restore behaviour of 395c55ff2f16bcd77dff6f06f20ea49ff06b59fd.
Honor init_size in string_map_put_to()
Update compat/hashtab.c with latest libiberty version  Synced from https://github.com/gcc-mirror/gcc/commits/releases/gcc-15.2.0/

Fix notes handling in the main view  Note that when using `git log`, notes can only be detected by examining their content, so we cannot distinguish between the absence of notes and empty notes created with `git notes add --allow-empty`.  Fixes #1394
Update manual link to point to mankier.com and remove link to Gitter
Update NEWS
Update utf8proc to v2.11.0  Unicode 17 support
Open the blame and blob views from diffstat
Fix issue with blame when using absolute file paths  Fixes #1391

Introduce committer column  The display of the committer column can be toggled by pressing the `T` key.  Note: Users should update the settings for the blame, main, reflog, and refs views in their ~/.tigrc file to include the committer column.
Fix crash caused by too many diff cells  Fixes #1389
Fix file mode diff header handling

Update display after setting column option (#1384)  This resolves issue that display is not updated after updating column option value like     :set main-view-date-use-author = yes  [tk: refactoring and fixed only view column options are prefixed]
Expand relevant sections only when opening the help view  Closes #782, closes #886
Add expand/collapse all options to help (#1382)  [tk: minor edits]
Add toggle options to help (#1381)  [tk: fixed grep and alignment of bindings descriptions]
Allow to hide +/- signs in the diff view  Use `:toggle diff-indicator` to show or hide the +/- signs in the diff view.  Closes #855, closes #901
Document how to get a `<` within TIG_SCRIPT  Closes #1357

Open diff view from blame at the correct line (#1375)  Make the diff view open at the line corresponding to the line that was selected in the blame view when pressing `<Enter>` (`:enter`).  The behaviour when pressing `d` (`:view-diff`) remains unchanged, the diff view opens at either the first line or the previously selected line.  Co-authored-by: Thomas Koutcher <thomas.koutcher@online.fr>
Blame view now works without a working tree  This is supported since Git v2.22.0.  This reverts commit 1c665689dd5ddf8df213ab7e90b80194a420d6bf.
Update Linux CI
Add color for cursor in backgrounded view  Closes #1374
fix the incorrect line shift after stage file (#1371)  Original-patch-by: Karl Liang <liang.karl@outlook.com>
Use correct line when using `:parent` in blame view  (#1372)

Use correct line from recursively blamed commit (#1370)  Running  	tig blame +28 tig-2.5.12 -- src/diff.c  and pressing "b" should keep the line containing "const char *diff_argv[] = }" selected. It actually moves the selection somewhere else.  This regressed in ca0809db (Fix cursor position after "Move to parent" in blame view, 2019-11-29).  That commit only meant to change "," (":back" or ":parent").  When we press "b" (":view-blame"), we want to use the original behavior from ba7c7d30 (Use file and line number information when loading blame for commit, 2009-02-07). Do that.  (Note that the behavior fixed by ca0809db regressed in 22807341 (Enable textconv in the blame view and fix blame -L (#1190), 2022-06-03).  I have not yet figured out what's going on, but this patch shouldn't make that worse.)  Fixes #1369
Fix AppVeyor build
Make $GIT_EDITOR value interpreted by the shell  Align Tig behaviour with that of Git.  Fixes #1367
Initialise %(head) from command line arguments  Fixes #1366
Update home page links  Replace outdated github.io links.  Closes #1341, closes #1364
Fix empty blame view when opened from the diff view on i586  The regression was introduced by 2a8ef0ffbc6c52270c9ce60d16dcf2c544428f92.  Fixes #1362
Change the date in generated documentation
Bump copyright year to 2025
Show stash, notes and prefetch in refs view with `tig refs --all`  Hide them by default and for other references, honor `reference-format = hide:tag`.  Closes #1359
Update utf8proc to v2.10.0  Unicode 16 and ambiguous width support  [tk: fixed C90 compliance]
Fix parsing of reflog designator in timestamp format

Update remote repo variables  %(repo:remote) = the remote name only %(repo:upstream) = the former %(repo:remote) with the upstream branch name  This introduces an incompatibility with previous versions.  Closes #1358
Refresh the view when toggling date-use-author  This is a complement to 7351f170b0e4e6f7675ccff9167b4892ed9f426b.  Reported-by: PaulChanHK <PaulChanHK@users.noreply.github.com>
Parse committer date in --pretty=raw output  This is a complement to 7351f170b0e4e6f7675ccff9167b4892ed9f426b.
Don't report an error when diff-highlight is killed intentionally
Keep cursor position in the main view when toggling rev-filter  Note: this will work only if rev is a subset of the current branch.  This is a complement to c96dd26bd028123151c7472e47d021ff597840bb.
Fix missing dates in the refs view

Show committer date by default in the date column  Although the author name is generally of more interest than the committer name, the committer date is more significant as it shows when the change was actually added to the commit history. Make it the default for the date column.  The author date can be restored on a per-view basis using the `use-author` option of the `date` column in the view settings of ~/.tigrc. See tigrc(5).  Note: to have both author date and committer date shown in the log view, add `--pretty=fuller` to `log-options`.  Closes #294
Enable search in sections titles  Closes #1043
Fix message upon edit from diffstat without patch
Allow different colors for all references types  Do not hide any reference type in the default tigrc.
Make errors visible in views showing Git output  Closes #1346
Keep cursor position in the main view when toggling file-filter from split diff view  Rework c96dd26bd028123151c7472e47d021ff597840bb
Fix `Ctrl-C` behavior within the Readline prompt (#1342)  [tk: fixed regression with the `Enter` key]

Fix staging with `diff.noprefix` and `--no-prefix`  Note that the option `--default-prefix` works only if the installed Git version supports it (2.41 and onward). The option is just passed through in order not to break older versions support.
Fix parsing of `--no-prefix` argument
Keep cursor position when toggling file-filter in the main view
Open the blob corresponding to the diff line  Fixes #1334

Make `Ctrl-C` to kill only the command running in the foreground  Ignore `INT` signal while executing a command in the foreground and always reset all signal handlers to default in the child process.  Fixes #1331
Fix compilation warnings with ncurses 6.5  Assume `#define NCURSES_OPAQUE 0` was only needed with ncurses 5.7.
Fix editing when stdin is redirected  Closes #1330

Fix reopening the blame view from the main view  * Update %(ref) when opening the blame view from the main view.  * Rework 683fdc86374da5ce03ddabc271157e601a8fda0b to set %(file) only   when opening the blob view and bring back %(file_old).
Fix keybinding with +[cmd] not triggering view refreshing (#1324)  Also report standard error output and remove "No output" notice.

Fix incorrect filename coloring in tig status (#1326)  Due to the way commit a37ce5cfe1f256b81092dda365b1d66450e0929e updated src/draw.c:draw_filename() the whole line in `tig status` got colored according to `stat-*` which are supposed to color only status markers.  This reverts part of that commit which was done for consistency with the changes made to draw_filesize().  [tk: also revert and rework draw_file_size() for consistency and add  comments.]
Fix parsing of `git ls-tree` for submodules  Closes #1282
Clear keybinding from all keymaps (unbind) with `bind generic <key> none`

Improve the blob view experience  * Fix opening the blob view for the same file from a different commit.  * Set %(file) rather than %(file_old) in the blame view to allow the   blob view to open properly.  * Allow faster access to the blob view when using `tig <file>`.
Reset state variables when selecting a commit with no reference
Show the selected commit in the blame view title window

refdb: ignore prefetch refs (#1318)  * refdb: add prefetch reference type  * tigrc: document fallback for reference-format  * tigrc: hide prefetch references by default  These are created by `git maintenance` and are special-cased in git tools to not be shown, since they are mostly noise.
Fix regression introduced in e2f1af4

Fix untracked changes staging behaviour in plain stage view  * Close the view after staging an untracked file.  * Fix issue with 11238ef7fb35ab769cf673c1f90b99bc634c7d13 and maximized   views to allow the use of WATCH_INDEX trigger.
Minor update to tigrc and doc
Update NEWS
Bump copyright year to 2024

Fix chunk staging behaviour in plain stage view  * Reflect changes in the Untracked / Unstaged / Staged changes lines   when returning to the main view after partial staging / unstaging.  * Close the view after staging the last chunk.
Allow to go to stage view without Enter  Simplified version of PR #1284. Test is from the original PR.  Closes #1284  Original-patch-by: Johannes Altmanninger <aclopte@gmail.com>

Fix status view lockup  Steps to reproduce: - go to the status view - open a split stage view from a file - move cursor in the status view to a `(no files)` line - maximize the stage view  Close the stage view when the selected line in the status view does not point to a valid stage content.

Move default log view options to tigrc  This allows to remove the resource-intensive `--cc --stat` when dealing with large repositories. It can be done on a per repository basis with `git config tig.log-options ''`.
Use HTTPS for GitHub clone URLs (#1310)  GitHub has dropped support for the git:// protocol: https://github.blog/changelog/2022-03-15-removed-unencrypted-git-protocol-and-certain-ssh-keys/
Fix tig blame --reverse  Fixes #1300
Fixed an issue where is*() function argument was not cast as unsigned char.
Support %(text) in all views with a text column  PR #457 implemented %(text) for the pager view only. Extend %(text) support to the blame, blob, grep and log views.  Fixes #1275
Fix readline echo when stdin is redirected  Fixes #1229
Also use lightweight tags in the Refs line of the diff view  Closes #1235
Update GitHub checkout action to v4
Fix display non-ascii character (#1299)  [tk: added missing occurences and fixed behaviour on macOS]
Cast the argument passed to is*() function in ctype.h to unsigned char.
Update utf8proc to v2.9.0  Unicode 15.1 support
Fix refresh-mode periodic not updating branch labels  This is a regression from #991. Bring back and improve correction from #591.  Fixes #1270
Enforce a blank before view scroll percentage

update_view_title: Fix NULL dereference at startup (#1293)  update_view_title can be called with a `struct view` where `line` is NULL, and `lines` is 0.  Add a check for the value of line where it's first used.
Fix macOS CI

Initialise struct timezone (#1291)  On musl libc gettimeofday (which is used by time_now) does not populate the timezone struct passed to it as POSIX says:  > If tzp is not a null pointer, the behavior is unspecified.  tz_minuteswest is later multiplied by 60 which can overflow. When tig is compiled with integer overflow hardening (as is done on Chimera Linux) via the clang option -fsanitize=signed-integer-overflow this can result in tig crashing due to the overflow.
fix date so rpmbuild completes

Don't use array size in function arguments  The declaration of argv_to_string() mismatched its definition. The definition had the array size, the declaration had not. Remove array sizes from all functions declared in argv.h.  Array sizes in function arguments don't ensure the code correctness but can give a wrong impression that the compiler would check the array size.
Fix "dangling pointer" warning  Move file_status to the function scope so it doesn't go out of scope while file_in_head is pointing to the data it contains.
Fix warning introduced by #1255  Fixes #1259
Update NEWS
Replace sprintf() function with snprintf()  sprintf() has been deprecated in Xcode 14.
fix some implicit declarations (#1255)  * add strings.h include  this is required for strcasecmp  * pass _BSD_SOURCE and _DEFAULT_SOURCE by default  this is required for struct timezone
Include original blob name in temporary filename  Closes #1254
Add support for option word-diff-regex  Closes #1252

Clean IO before closing a view or quitting  Make sure that a command still running in a view is properly terminated when the view is closed. This is mostly visible in the pager view. That should pretty much make #828 redundant.

Allow use of regular expressions for coloring  When defining colors, strings of the form "/.../" will be interpreted as regular expressions.  E.g. color "/([^:]+):([0-9]+):(|([0-9]+):)[ \t]+(note|warning|error): (.*)(\[-W([a-zA-Z0-8_-]+)\]|)/"	yellow	default	bold  Closes #1249  Suggested-by: Sebastian Gniazdowski <sgniazdowski@gmail.com>
Fix diffstat color for tig log -p
Fix encoding of very long lines  Let the buffer grow as needed and show the original if encoding fails.  Fixes #1227

Replace `Unknown` author with `Not Committed Yet`  To be consistent with `git blame` and the blame view, use `Not Committed Yet` as the author of untracked, unstaged and staged changes in the main view.

Automatically show next diff in the status view  Move view_request() to view.c where it belongs and, when changing a file status in a split stage view spawned from the status view, use it to simulate pressing the Enter key in the parent view to display the next diff.  Note: the behaviour is similar to that of the Up and Down keys, the action has to be performed from the child view.  Closes #413, closes #469
Autoscroll in pager (#1223)  Autoscroll the pager view if a new option `pager-autoscroll` is set to `on`.  [tk: tweaked the code and added doc]

Various cleanups  Rework stage_read() to remove the call to pager_read() as both are already delegating most of the work to diff_common_read().  Code removed from stash.c remained at the time the stash view was forked from the main view but the condition is never verified here.
Make tests work from a path with symlinks
Adjust build for native Apple Silicon  Look for dependencies in $HOMEBREW_PREFIX and use `brew --prefix` if it is not set.
Documentation update  The text for tig(1) was suggested by Matthijs Kooijman in #1040.

Fix stage view closing when holding the ] key  This is caused by 68f1c17b5ec814494872c5c41e5ada18c97771c1 closing the stage view when the command output is empty. This would normally happen when unstaged/staged contents are removed outside of Tig but also when the command is interrupted.  Do not close the view when stage_read() is called to flush the output. This makes 78012db73141b6b42ab818d69907c7eb8293bf25 redundant.  Also, make it work for both plain and split views and make sure previous view gets refreshed automatically.  Fixes #1245

Correctly report which version of libncurses was linked (#1241)  Later versions of ncurses (20111030 and up) support NCURSES_WIDECHAR even when compiling with libncurses instead of libncursesw.  Have tig correctly report whether it was linked against libncursesw or libncurses based off the same defines we set in the build script and use to determine which headers to include.  Per the build system, either of HAVE_NCURSESW_H or HAVE_NCURSESW_CURSES_H may indicate the presence of ncursesw, so both are checked.  (See #1240 as an example of where `tig --version` incorrectly reports `ncursesw` instead of `ncurses`).
Use %(file_old) for old filename in the blame view  Fixes #1226

Support editing from the log (-p) view  Limit the scope of search for the filename to the current commit.  Note that editing can only work with `log -p` due to the filename being extracted from the diff header as it may be abbreviated in the diffstat when it is too long.  Suggested-by: Johannes Altmanninger <aclopte@gmail.com>

Support editing from the pager view (#1243)  When working with pull requests, before merging to `master` it is nice to get the total diff of all of the commits of the PR, as in the `Files changed` tab on github. This is possible with `tig`, i.e. `git diff master | tig` or `:!git diff master`, but currently, this view does not support editing.  Make editing in the pager view possible.
Update utf8proc to v2.8.0  unicode 15 support
Fix tests not working with Git 2.38.1  CVE-2022-39253 mitigation broke submodule tests by disabling the file protocol by default, enable it when doing `git submodule add`.
Avoid incorrect history path when $XDG_DATA_HOME is valid (#1217)  Fixes #1215
Fix parsing of status.showUntrackedFiles  status.showUntrackedFiles is incorrecly parsed as a boolean. According to git-config(1), possible values are `no`, `normal` and `all`.  Fixes #1219
Fix running tests as root  CVE-2022-24765 mitigation in Git v2.35.2 introduced a check of ownership, so make sure untarred .git content belongs to the current user when running tests.  Fixes #1224
Fix segfault with PCRE  With PCRE 8.32, doing an invalid search, e.g. `(`, after a succesful one causes a segfault. Ensure view->regex still contains a valid compiled regular expression.
Minor cleanups
Honor commit_title:no in view settings  This allows to hide the commit title column by default in the refs view and to display it with `:toggle commit-title-display`.

Fix reading the value of status.showUntrackedFiles (#1211)  It seems like `git config --list` prints everything in lowercase. That results in `tig` not recognising the value of `status.showUntrackedFiles` since it's being printed as `status.showuntrackedfiles`.
Fix word diff in the stage, stash and blame views  Also remove `--root` argument when not relevant and `-M` which is redundant with `-C`.  Fixes #1207
Create tig directory in $XDG_DATA_HOME  If the environment variable $XDG_DATA_HOME is set, create tig directory automatically in $XDG_DATA_HOME.
Oops, input length must be adjusted as well
Fix alignment of transliterated text  Compute length after transliteration.  Fixes #1195
Update lineno for untracked files (#1193)  Fixes #1192
Update blame test  Previous regression could have been detected by the existing test but the sed on the result file prevented it.
Restore jump to the blamed line  Regression introduced by #1190 in 2280734104fd362a1188b0678109e01cdb9322cf.  Reported-by: Johannes Altmanninger <aclopte@gmail.com>

Enable textconv in the blame view and fix blame -L (#1190)  Change the blame view to use the porcelain output rather than loading the file and adding blame information based on the incremental output.  Fixes #978 Fixes #1189  Reviewed-by: Johannes Altmanninger <aclopte@gmail.com>
Fix AppVeyor build
Enable textconv in the stage view
Fix navigation in split tree view  Do not descend in directories when hovering the cursor in the tree view while viewing a blob. To enter a directory, use <Tab> first to change the active view.

Fix cursor behaviour during staging  In the status view, when the `Changes to be committed` section is empty, a line with `(no files)` is inserted. This line disappears when the first file is staged, this has to be taken into account for the cursor position.  Fixes #842, #1028
Add an initial compact custom date format  References #1122
Update license in spec file
Bump copyright year to 2022

Improve escaping of variables in external commands  Interpret %% as % (like printf).  This is a complement to 6134336333b67c3ab632036e1311a4ca895db8fd.  Suggested-by: Johannes Altmanninger <aclopte@gmail.com>
Update NEWS

Use the full width for diffstat in the stage view  The diff-files and diff-index commands used in the stage view need to have the screen width passed explicitly with --stat argument to generate an adjusted diffstat, as they ignore the COLUMNS environment variable.  The view arguments are not reevaluated upon refresh, so insert `--stat=<width>` just before calling io_exec(), whenever `--stat` or `--patch-with-stat` is present.
Fix search when view is loading  Make find-next reach newly added content when the search was initiated before the view is fully loaded.

Fix opening of an ambiguous ref in refs view  When pressing Enter in the refs view after selecting a branch name matching a tag name, the main view will open on the tag instead. Use the ref id rather than the ref name in git log arguments to avoid the ambiguity.

Revert terminal hacks and workarounds  The extra redrawwin() added by b445baeb8e9c67d1d3cf943e350cbd4fd0cbd174 to fix a scrolling bug in (u)xterm is causing flickering when paging in XTerm(370).  As the original issues with xterm and gnome-terminal cannot be reproduced anymore even on a now antique distro, revert the associated workarounds.  Fixes #1180
Fix typo in ui.c
Fix `:goto <tag>`  Dereference goto argument to make sure we try to reach the commit and not the tag object for annotated tags.  Reviewed-by: Johannes Altmanninger <aclopte@gmail.com>
Fix crash on :toggle file-args  Reported-by: Johannes Altmanninger <aclopte@gmail.com>

Don't treat pathspecs as format strings  As reported by Johannes Altmanninger, 5d34f57527a3415339ee97636ca355c08a1831a9 would have caused a weird behaviour of `tig -- './%(fileargs)'`. Revert to using argv_append() but check for an empty argument before.
Update NEWS

Fix null dereferences on unset %(fileargs) (#1159)  Commit 9b262f6b (Fix null dereferences on unset state variable, 2021-07-24) fixed crashes on ":echo %(cmdlineargs)" but not on ":echo %(fileargs)". (which is embarassing because the latter is even mentioned in the commit message, but not in the test).  [tk: tweaked the code and the log message to respect the original test case behaviour. Use format_append_argv() for %(fileargs) and %(revargs) as well.]

Allow to toggle revision filtering (#1173)  "tig -- <pathspec>" shows only commits that touch files matching <pathspec>.  The command ":toggle file-filter" (bound to %) can be used to toggle this filtering dynamically.  "tig <revisions range>" shows only commits in the given range. This patch adds ":toggle rev-filter" (bound to ^) to quickly toggle this filter.  This feature is particularly useful with a new feature in Tig 2.5.2: when pressing m in the blame view, Tig will show the blamed commit centered in the main view, making it easy to explore adjacent commits. Note that if there are many commits between the blamed commit and HEAD, you'll need to wait a bit after pressing m.  [tk: fixed tab in manual.adoc and tweaked the log message]

argv_format(): extract boolean parameters into bitfield  argv_format() takes two boolean parameters, and the next patch wants to add another one.  Add the same bitfield to struct format_context, instead of just the file-filter bit.  This is not strictly needed -- we don't read the extra bits -- but this forces us to consistently access it with "& argv_flag_file_filter", also in callees of argv_format().
Auto refresh view upon option change
Add reference types stash and other (#1172)  This makes it possible to filter refs created by tools such as git-branchless with `set reference-format = hide:other`.  Closes #1160
Honor reference-format = hide:tag in diff view (#1170)  Fixes #1168
Update distclean rule to preserve tarball contents (#1169)  ... and replace it with new veryclean rule.  Closes #1167
Fix status line when toggling general options (#1164)  The regression was introduced by #944 in 80b40c20607d9d2b324c8a5a8c390d0c89de600b.  Fixes #1163
Fix navigation between chunks after splitting chunk (#1162)  Also fix the color of the first split chunk.  Closes #1101  Reviewed-by: Johannes Altmanninger <aclopte@gmail.com>
Avoiding null pointer dereference (#1096)  [tk: fixed C90 compliance and tweaked error messages]
Document options for 'tig refs'  They are useful but not documented anywhere so far.  Signed-off-by: Wolfram Sang <wsa@kernel.org>

Mention again that 'generic' keymap can be overridden  There is a paragraph above to explain 'generic' in detail. Redundancy is not a bad thing in documentation, though. In other words, I missed it before and this extra information would have helped me.  Signed-off-by: Wolfram Sang <wsa@kernel.org>
Update utf8proc to v2.7.0
Replace useless strncpy to avoid compilation warning with GCC 8  This is a complement to 29b04e95f458d2e4e352b3937d0c546e51e135c2.

Avoid pushing identical history state in main view  With #1138, using `:parent` after reaching an initial commit will keep pushing the same state in the main view history, and `:back` must then be used several times before it starts moving. Use lineno as data to prevent pushing the same history state.  This a complement to 2e31516f34f1228cc16563db4b9093d4425fa7d8.
Print the PCRE version  Also add PCRE2 to contrib/config.make and config.make-Darwin.  This is a complement to 6f609b193844ffe8a2287d0846c52d74bd6b83db.

Remove quotes from TIG_LS_REMOTE to allow inline shell commands (#1161)  The environment variable TIG_LS_REMOTE can be used to select the references that Tig will display.  When using a command like TIG_LS_REMOTE='sh -c "a | b"' tig, we pass an argv-array with 3 elements to execvpe.  The third argument is passed with quotes, which means that the shell tries to run a command that is literally called 'a | b'.  Fix this by removing quotes. We already split arguments with a shell-like syntax, so this only improves compatibility.  This makes it easier filter away unwanted refs (#1160) without creating a script TIG_LS_REMOTE.

Makefile: avoid overzealous removal of compile_commands.json (#1157)  Our logic to generate a compilation database is copied (almost verbatim) from Git's Makefile,  However, one difference is that before creating compile_commands.json we always remove it. This doesn't seem very useful, plus it thwarts the logic two lines below to overwrite compile_commands.json only if we successfully created a non-empty file.  I believe I added this while debugging this logic.  I'm not sure in which scenarios this actually makes a difference, but it seems wrong to keep it.
Add more trailers to default tigrc  Include the top 10% from git.git: https://lore.kernel.org/git/60ad75ac7ffca_2ae08208b@natae.notmuch/  Thanks-to: Felipe Contreras <felipe.contreras@gmail.com>

Pass command line args through to diff-files in status view (#1155)  This makes it possible to use `tig --ignore-submodules` to speed up the status view for a repo with many submodules.  Closes #1152  Reported-by: Benjamin Titmus <ben.titmus@cantab.net> Reviewed-by: Johannes Altmanninger <aclopte@gmail.com>

Fix stash view when using tig --all or tig revs (#1147)  This is a regression from #1030 due to a wrong handling of --all, --branches, --remotes and revisions arguments in `git stash list`. Workaround the issue by filtering them from %(revargs).  Fixes #1146
Run macOS CI on pushes and pull requests (#1144)  Previously macOS CI only ran on master pushes.  We already run six Linux configurations on each push, so test at least the macOS defaults as well.
Add PCRE support (#1143)  Closes #1137
Enable jumping back in main view (#1138)  Allow going back to the previously selected commit after jumping to its parent.  Fixes #628  [tk: added test]

Fix blame when opened from an initial diff view (#1135)  When running "tig show 529182c -- README.adoc", blames were started on HEAD instead of 529182c.  Fix this by reading the commit line of the displayed diff.  This also works when multiple commits are shown ("tig show --all").  Using %(commit) instead of parsing the commit line did unfortunately not work because, because %(commit) can contain the wrong SHA for when returning from a blame view to a stash view, see test/blame/stash-test.  Sadly, stashes don't contain commit lines, so we need to find out their SHAs in another way. Once we fix %(commit), we can use it, but for now this commit adds a workaround to use the old "view->vid", which seems to be set in the cases where display the output from "git stash show".  Also, when blame is requested on a context line, use the current commit rather than its parent.  This does not change behavior since a context line can never be blamed on the current commit, but this is consistent with the stage view, which only uses HEAD for deletions and the index for others.  [ja: add test and commit message]  Co-authored-by: Thomas Koutcher <thomas.koutcher@online.fr>

Expose %(file_old), the filename before a rename or deletion (#1132)  This improves interaction with external tools that require file names.  Implemented by extending diff_get_pathname. We don't handle prefixes like "diff --cc" when computing %(file_old), because we can't tell yet if such a line is "old" or "new". Git only uses these combined headers for binary files, and other edge cases, see: PAGER='less +1206' git show 75ae10b:combine-diff.c Anyway, this is not really important because %(file) already has the correct name.  An alternative (partial) solution would be to change %(file) to the old filename but only for deleted files. I decided against this; while it would be convenient for some basic scenarios, it hides information which makes scripting more difficult.  Another, more general solution for these kinds of problems would be to allow to pipe the raw diff to user scripts.
Further fix to fullscreen navigation  LINE_MAIN_ANNOTATED was forgotten in de7bb0a when checking the switch from Untracked/Unstaged/Staged changes line to commit line.
Merge pull request #1128 from koutcher/log-view-fixes  Log view fixes
Add auto-refresh to log view

Restore support for tig log --graph  Support for `tig log --graph` was added in 2.0 with fa2fcc9 but was later broken in 2.2 with 178c45c when the box structure was implemented. This makes it work again, though it would be cleaner to move the implementation from draw.c to log.c and pager.c, using the box structure.
Fix invalid read in log_read

Allow :back to work across separate blame views (#1127)  * stop clearing the history state when entering the blame view  * push a blame view history state before entering the diff view  * stop failing when trying to push an identical history state  Closes #1123
Add Linux installation instructions (#1126)  Closes #1121
Make word-diff a toggleable option (#1125)  Closes #1119
Merge pull request #1136 from krobelus/empty-format-nil-deref  Fix null dereferences on unset format strings
Simplify return expression that is implied by loop invariant.

Fix null dereferences on unset state variable  Tig knows three kinds of state variables that encode different information: 1. the state of the view (ARGV_ENV_INFO), like %(commit) 2. the state of the worktree (REPO_INFO), like %(repo:head) 3. the arguments given on the commandline, like %(fileargs)  The values exposed by the first two kinds are never null, but most of the third kind default to null.  Prior to this commit when trying to format a null value, argv_format() reported success but left the output string as null. Fix this by writing the empty string in format_append_argv(), because current callers (echo) don't really care about the difference between empty and null.  Reproduce the null dereferences with  	:!%(fileargs) 	:echo %(fileargs)  Surprisingly to me, this did not break this example:  	bind generic aaa !sh -c 'printf "%s\n" "$@" | wc -l' -- line1 %(fileargs) line2 	# still prints 2  because of the early return in argv_appendn().  In future we should also fix format_append_arg(), which currently fails on  	:echo "%(fileargs)"  because format_expand_arg() does not receive variables like %(fileargs).
Update links to use HTTPS (#1148)
Use TIG_NCURSES instead of TIG_LDLIBS in config.make-Linux  As reported by Peff, using TIG_LDLIBS here would result in linking with `-lcurses -lncursesw` while we expect `-lncursesw` only.
Replace obsolete macro `AC_CONFIG_HEADER' in configure.ac
Use ncursesw by default on Linux  References #920
Update NEWS
